definition: to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life

sentences.english: Head and nose and shoulders back legs, vivid, each are outlined in a vividly.
sentences.chinese: 头鼻肩腰脚，栩栩如生，每一笔都勾画的惟妙惟肖。

sentences.english: Here are a large amount of Taihu Stones with strange shapes in various poses, all vivid to life.
sentences.chinese: 这里是一片奇形怪状的太湖石，千姿百态，惟妙惟肖。

sentences.english: Although mockingbirds superbly mimic the songs and calls of many birds.
sentences.chinese: 尽管模仿鸟学很多种鸟的鸣叫声惟妙惟肖。

sentences.english: It was the best take-off of the Prime Minister that I have ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 这是我所见过的对首相最惟妙惟肖的模仿。

sentences.english: This is the more annoying, as I was formerly very happy in taking likenesses .
sentences.chinese: 我为此十分苦恼，因为不久前我还是画得惟妙惟肖的。

sentences.english: Joe imitates animal calls and can hit off cows and sheep perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 他会学动物叫，能惟妙惟肖地模仿牛羊的叫声。

sentences.english: He spoofed the movement of his boss , which set everybody laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他惟妙惟肖模仿他老板的动作引得大家一阵大笑。

sentences.english: He spoofed the movement of his boss, which set everybody laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他惟妙惟肖模仿他老板的动作引得大家一阵大笑。

sentences.english: He even could imitate them perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至能惟妙惟肖地模仿他们。

sentences.english: She was secretly Cumei Tears of expression, written charm, the people poor.
sentences.chinese: 她那暗自蹙眉垂泪的神情，写得惟妙惟肖，楚楚动人。

sentences.english: His figure painting can best present his artistic idea of "being true to life".
sentences.chinese: 徐悲鸿的人物画最能体现其“惟妙惟肖”的艺术主张。

definition: living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
lit. fine sculpting (idiom); fig. to work with extreme care and precision
in different poses and with different expressions/in thousands of postures (idiom)
